title: New H-1B Visa Rules Come Into Effect Today: What Does It Mean For Indian Workers? - News18
summary:
New H-1B Visa Rules Come Into Effect Today: What Does It Mean For Indian Workers?

Date: January 17, 2025 Source: News18

The US administration has announced significant changes to the H-1B visa programme, effective from January 17, aimed at ensuring fairness, transparency, and efficiency in recruiting foreign talent.

  • Indians make up the largest group of H-1B visa holders, receiving 72.3% of visas granted in 2023.
  • Two main objectives for modernizing the programme: clarifying requirements and increasing efficiency.
  • The definition of specialized work has been revised to require a logical connection between the degree and job responsibilities.
  • F-1 visa holders‚Äô statuses will now be automatically extended during the H-1B application process.
  • Non-profit and government research organizations are now exempt from the H-1B cap under certain conditions.
  • Employers must provide proof of a legitimate specialty job when applying for H-1B visas.
‚ÄúThese reforms are designed to streamline the visa approval process and enhance programme flexibility.‚Äù - US Citizenship and Immigration Services

With revised rules in place, Indian tech professionals stand to benefit significantly from these changes in the H-1B visa program.
newTitle: New H-1B Visa Rules Come Into Effect Today: What Does It Mean For Indian Workers?

title: Israel-Hamas ceasefire live updates: Hostages to be released on Sunday despite delays in cabinet - Hindustan Times
summary:
Israel-Hamas Ceasefire Update: Hostage Release Scheduled Amid Delays

Published Date: Jan 17, 2025, Source: Hindustan Times

Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has announced a deal to release hostages held by Hamas in Gaza, coinciding with a ceasefire agreement that halts 15 months of conflict.

  • Netanyahu confirmed that the ceasefire would start on Sunday, as 33 Israeli hostages would be released in the first phase.
  • A coalition of the US, Egypt, and Qatar facilitated the agreement, following prolonged negotiations.
  • Statistics from the ongoing conflict indicate significant civilian casualties, with 46,707 reported deaths in Gaza.
  • Hamas seized 251 hostages during an attack on October 7, 2023, shortly before the ceasefire announcement.
  • Netanyahu's coalition faces internal challenges with opposition from far-right factions regarding the hostage deal.
‚ÄúWe didn‚Äôt believe that 15 months would pass and the world doesn‚Äôt help him,‚Äù said a family member of a hostage.

This ceasefire marks a crucial development in the long-standing conflict, with implications for humanitarian efforts and future negotiations.

title: 'Will be very cold': Donald Trump's inauguration on January 20 to be coldest US president swearing-in of recent history - Hindustan Times
summary:
Trump's Upcoming Inauguration Forecasted to Be Coldest in Recent History

Publication Date: Jan 17, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

As Donald Trump prepares to take the oath of office, forecasts suggest the inauguration could be one of the coldest in US history. The event, scheduled for January 20, is expected to occur amidst bitterly cold temperatures and a chance of snow.

  • The ceremony will take place with temperatures well below the seasonal average, potentially dropping into the teens.
  • Forecasts predict wind chills in the single digits and gusty winds reaching up to 30 mph.
  • The cold weather may evoke memories of past extreme inaugurations, particularly Ronald Reagan's second in 1985.
  • Despite the harsh conditions, officials plan to proceed with the inauguration as scheduled.
‚ÄúThis will be a very cold day, with wind chill values in the single digits to low teens,‚Äù said Brian LaSorsa, meteorologist with the National Weather Service.

Trump's inauguration is set against a backdrop of historic cold, and public preparations are underway for a challenging weather experience during the significant event.
newTitle: Trump's Upcoming Inauguration Forecasted to Be Coldest in Recent History

title: Expert Explains: Unpacking Israel-Hamas deal - The Indian Express
summary:
Key Takeaways from the Israel-Hamas Ceasefire Agreement

Date: January 17, 2025

Source: The Indian Express

Mediators in Doha, Qatar, have agreed on a phased ceasefire deal in Gaza aimed at alleviating tensions and restoring some level of peace.

  • The ceasefire will begin with a 42-day first phase starting Sunday.
  • During this period, Hamas is to release 33 hostages.
  • Israel will release between 900 and 1,650 Palestinian detainees, including all those detained since October 7, 2023.

This agreement is a critical step towards de-escalation in the long-standing conflict in the region, although the effectiveness of the ceasefire will depend on compliance from both parties.
newTitle: Key Takeaways from the Israel-Hamas Ceasefire Agreement

summary:
India and China Clash in South China Sea as Chinese Vessel Shadows Indian Ship

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Eurasian Times

An Indian Coast Guard ship returning from Japan was followed by a Chinese Coast Guard vessel as it traversed the contested waters near the Scarborough Shoal. This incident highlights ongoing tensions in the South China Sea amidst aggressive Chinese maritime tactics.

  • The Chinese Coast Guard has expanded rapidly, with over 1,275 vessels posing a security challenge in the Indo-Pacific region.
  • Recent confrontations include Chinese vessels shadowing ships from the Philippines and India.
  • India's naval presence in the region is growing, with recent military engagements and arms deals with Southeast Asian nations.
  • China's Coast Guard operates under new laws allowing aggressive measures to assert territorial claims.
‚ÄúIndia Coast Guard Ship ICGS Shaunak returning from a goodwill visit to Japan is shadowed by China Coast Guard 3304 as it passes west of Scarborough Shoal.‚Äù - Ray Powell

The ongoing naval activities between India and China signify a substantial shift in maritime dynamics in the South China Sea, with India taking a more assertive stance.

title: Pakistan ex-PM Imran Khan, wife Bushra Bibi convicted in graft case - The Hindu
Pakistan ex-PM Imran Khan, wife Bushra Bibi convicted in al-Qadir Trust case - The Hindu
summary:
Pakistan ex-PM Imran Khan, wife Bushra Bibi convicted in al-Qadir Trust case

Date: January 17, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

A Pakistan court sentenced former Prime Minister Imran Khan to 14 years in prison and his wife Bushra Bibi to 7 years for corruption related to the al-Qadir Trust case, involving losses of 190 million pounds.

  • The verdict, delivered by Judge Nasir Javed Rana, resulted from a case initiated by the National Accountability Bureau (NAB) in December 2023.
  • Khan and Bibi were fined and face additional imprisonment if they fail to pay.
  • The conviction has raised concerns about the integrity of the judiciary according to Khan's comments.
  • This ruling adds to Khan's legal troubles since his ouster as PM in 2022, as he faces numerous pending cases.
  • The political situation remains tense as negotiations are ongoing between the government and Khan‚Äôs political party, PTI.
‚ÄúToday‚Äôs verdict has tarnished the reputation of the judiciary...‚Äù - Imran Khan

The conviction of Khan and Bibi represents both a legal and a political crisis in Pakistan, further complicating the country's already unstable governance.
newTitle: Imran Khan and Bushra Bibi Convicted in Corruption Case

Gardner, King help Australia complete ODI series sweep - Cricbuzz
summary:
Gardner, King help Australia complete ODI series sweep

Published on Fri, Jan 17, 2025, 06:38 AM | Source Cricbuzz

Australia secured a convincing 86-run victory over England in the third ODI, completing a series sweep. Ashleigh Gardner celebrated her maiden ODI century, while Alana King starred with the ball.

  • Ashleigh Gardner scored 102 runs, marking her first ODI century.
  • Tahlia McGrath and Beth Mooney contributed with scores of 55 and 50, respectively.
  • Australia set a target of 308 runs.
  • Alana King took 5 wickets for 46 runs, playing a crucial role in England's collapse.
  • England managed 222 runs in 42.2 overs, with Nat Sciver-Brunt scoring 61 and Tammy Beaumont 54.
The match showcased exceptional performances both with bat and ball, highlighting Australia's dominance in ODIs.

This match exemplified Australia's strength in women's cricket, showcasing emerging talents and solidifying their position in international play.
newTitle: Gardner and King Lead Australia to ODI Series Victory

  • Trump will be sworn in on January 20 at the U.S. Capitol.
  • Foreign leaders include India's S. Jaishankar, Japan's Takeshi Iwaya, and Argentina's Javier Milei.
  • Chinese Vice President Han Zheng will represent China, while Xi Jinping will not attend.

  • Prominent tech leaders, such as Jeff Bezos, Mark Zuckerberg, and Elon Musk, are also planning to attend.
  • Notable absences include French President Macron and U.K. Prime Minister Keir Starmer.

title: TikTok ban: Biden hands over Chinese app's fate to Trump before White House exit - Hindustan Times
summary:
Biden Hands Over TikTok's Fate to Trump Ahead of Exit

Publication Date: Date not specified | Source: Hindustan Times

As President Biden prepares to leave office, he will not enforce a TikTok ban enacted by Congress, transferring the decision to President-elect Trump, who has previously expressed both support and opposition to the app.

  • Biden will not enforce the upcoming TikTok ban before his departure.
  • The law requires TikTok's parent company, ByteDance, to divest by January 19.
  • Trump's administration may work to extend the deadline for a potential deal.
  • Senate leaders showed bipartisan support for extending the deadline to avoid disruption for users.
  • The Supreme Court is considering a legal challenge to the TikTok ban.
Chuck Schumer stated, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs clear that more time is needed to find an American buyer and not disrupt the lives and livelihoods of millions of Americans.‚Äù

As TikTok's future remains uncertain, it will be crucial to watch how the new administration handles the app's potential ban and its implications for users and the digital landscape.

title: Trump's Treasury Pick Scott Bessent Pours Cold Water on US Digital Dollar Initiative - Decrypt
summary:
Trump's Treasury Pick Scott Bessent Pours Cold Water on US Digital Dollar Initiative

Date: January 2024 Source: Decrypt

During a Senate confirmation hearing, Scott Bessent, President-elect Donald Trump's nominee for Treasury Secretary, expressed his opposition to the implementation of a U.S. central bank digital currency (CBDC), stating he sees no need for it.

  • Bessent stated, "I see no reason for the U.S. to have a central bank digital currency" during the confirmation hearing.
  • His stance contrasts with ongoing federal CBDC exploration as various agencies consider its potential benefits.
  • If confirmed, Bessent could reverse current federal efforts to research CBDCs, aligning with Trump's previous promises against a U.S. CBDC.
  • Broader Republican opposition to CBDCs includes legislative moves like the House's passage of the Anti-Surveillance State Act.
  • A large majority of countries globally are currently exploring their own CBDC initiatives, impacting discussions in the U.S.
"Central bank digital currencies (CBDCs) are digital versions of a nation's fiat currency and have been explored for years in the U.S."

In conclusion, Bessent's remarks could significantly influence the future of digital currency policy under the new administration and mark a divergence from trends seen in numerous global economies.
newTitle: Trump's Treasury Pick Scott Bessent Opposes US Digital Dollar Initiative

summary:
Indian National Sentenced to 8 Years for Attempted Attack on White House

Date: January 17, 2025

Source: The Hindu

Indian national Sai Varshith Kandula was sentenced to eight years for an attempted attack on the White House with a rented truck, aiming to overthrow the U.S. government.

  • Kandula pled guilty to willful injury to U.S. property.
  • He drove a truck onto a sidewalk and crashed into security barriers near the White House.
  • He brandished a Nazi flag after the crash, promoting a dictatorship.
  • Kandula caused an estimated $4,322 in damage.
  • He had planned the attack for weeks, trying to acquire armed guards and larger vehicles.
‚ÄúKandula's intent was to replace the democratically elected government with a dictatorship fueled by ideology of Nazi Germany,‚Äù stated the Department of Justice.

summary:
Pakistan Eclipses Indian Navy In AIP-Submarine Tech! Set To Widen The Gap With Chinese Hangor-Class Subs

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Eurasian Times

This article discusses how Pakistan is making significant advancements in its naval capabilities, specifically through the acquisition of Air Independent Propulsion (AIP) technology for its submarine fleet, contrasting it with the Indian Navy's current limitations.

  • Pakistan has successfully integrated AIP technology in its Agosta-90B submarines.
  • The Hangor-class submarines, expected to enter service by the late 2020s to early 2030s, will enhance Pakistan's naval strength to 11 AIP-equipped submarines.
  • Despite financial constraints, Pakistan continues to bolster its naval fleet to compete with India.
  • Admiral Naveed Ashraf highlighted the operational improvements due to the Hangor-class submarines.
  • India is still developing AIP technology and faces delays in its submarine modernization program.
‚ÄúThe project is proceeding as per the timeline. We expect that these submarines will join the Pakistan Navy fleet very soon.‚Äù - Admiral Naveed Ashraf

The growing naval capabilities of Pakistan, particularly through Chinese collaboration and technological advancements, pose new challenges in regional security dynamics, especially against the backdrop of India's slower progress in submarine technology.
newTitle: Pakistan Eclipses Indian Navy In AIP-Submarine Tech: A New Era in Naval Capabilities
